topics.body:
I know I use analogies a lot, but to use one imagine the generic fps crowd as a high school clique where everyone is trying to hang out with the star football quarterback and the only reason why anyone hangs in that clique is that they want to be with the cool kid.  If that cool kid no longer went to that high school or stopped playing football then chances are that clique would dispel.


Obviously the video game market will survive; it's just going to be a problem for generic fps games.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Silent_Witness":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545891f46368725860d10000#post_545891f46368725860d10000
Speaking of Mark, I mentioned this elsewhere, but I would love to do an LP of a game. The main reason why I haven't is because I lack any sort of technical know-how in order to record it (though I'm sure I could probably just look it up somewhere). The other reason I haven't done it is because I don't know if my voice is one people would be willing to listen to for extended periods of time.
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

When I was younger being a cyclops tends to turn most people away. But in the recent years it seems the opposite.

if people can stand shmorky's voice, I'm sure they can put up with yours. The biggest thing is sounding confident. Just imagine how much less entertaining markiplier would be if he just spent his videos mumbling to himself.

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545897996368721904610000#post_545897996368721904610000
Volume I don't think is a problem (at least, I don't think it is- I'd have to do a bit of recording to be sure), though since I tend to be rather camera-shy, I don't think I could pull off the "have myself up in a window in the corner" thing like Mark has. So that just leaves the technical bits.

And, there's the minor issue that I don't actually have the game I want to LP. I do own it, I just didn't bring it with me.
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3
